physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient 1: Swelling of the tongue observed. Patient 2: Lip angioedema observed after surgery for a duodenal ulcer. Patient 3: Recurrent swelling of the upper lip and tongue.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1 experienced an initial episode of tongue swelling which gradually subsided; a second attack with severe tongue swelling occurred three months later, leading to airway obstruction. Patient 3's angioedema attacks occurred once a week but ceased after treatment with tranexamic acid over two years.
